definitions: determined and serious in attitude or intention with depth of purpose
part payment made to bind a contract or agreement
examples: She began studying in earnest for her medical boards
The negotiations proceeded in earnest after months of delays
They gave ten thousand dollars as earnest money for the house
The earnest deposit secured their bid on the property

definitions: decorative ornament worn on the ear attached through pierced lobe or clip
examples: She wore diamond earrings to the wedding reception
His gold earring glinted in the sunlight

definitions: distance within which sounds can be heard by a person
examples: Stay within earshot while playing in the yard
They waited until the boss was out of earshot before complaining

definitions: third planet from the sun where all human life exists
soft material forming the ground consisting of minerals and organic matter
electrical connection to the ground serving as zero voltage reference
examples: Earth orbits the sun once every three hundred sixty-five days
Astronauts photographed Earth from the International Space Station
The gardener filled the pots with fresh earth and compost
They dug through layers of earth to reach bedrock
The electrician connected the wire to earth for safety
Proper earth connection prevents electrical shock hazards

definitions: pottery made from clay fired at relatively low temperatures producing porous material
examples: The kitchen displayed rustic earthenware bowls and plates
Ancient earthenware vessels were discovered at the archaeological site

definitions: sudden violent shaking of ground caused by movement of tectonic plates
examples: The earthquake measured seven point two on the Richter scale
Buildings collapsed during the devastating earthquake in Japan

definitions: embankment or fortification made of earth used in engineering or military construction
large-scale artwork created by moving and sculpting the land itself
examples: Ancient earthworks surrounded the medieval castle for defense
Engineers built massive earthworks to contain the floodwaters
The artist created stunning earthworks visible only from aerial view
Spiral Jetty remains one of the most famous earthworks ever created

definitions: elongated invertebrate animal living in soil that improves fertility through burrowing
examples: Earthworms aerate the soil as they tunnel through gardens
Fishermen collected earthworms for bait early in the morning

definitions: freedom from difficulty or effort in accomplishing something
state of comfort and relaxation without worry or pain
careful slow movement especially to avoid jarring or damage
examples: She completed the complex calculations with remarkable ease
The new software allows ease of access to all features
He lived a life of ease after selling his company
The medication brought ease from her chronic pain
The crane operator eased the beam into its final position
She eased the car into the tight parking space

definitions: upright frame for holding canvas or board while artist paints
examples: The painter adjusted her canvas on the wooden easel
Students set up their easels for the outdoor painting class

definitions: legal right to use another person's land for specific limited purpose without possessing it
examples: The utility company holds an easement to access power lines
Their property includes an easement allowing beach access for neighbors

definitions: gradual reduction in intensity, severity, or difficulty of something
act of making something less tight, strict, or severe
examples: The easing of tensions between nations improved diplomatic relations
Economic easing measures stimulated consumer spending
The easing of restrictions allowed businesses to reopen fully
Gentle easing of muscle tension helps prevent injury

definitions: direction toward sunrise at ninety degrees from north
region or area lying in the eastern part of a country or continent
examples: The sun rises in the east every morning
Turn east at the intersection to reach downtown
They moved from the East Coast to California
Trade routes connected East and West for centuries

definitions: Christian festival celebrating resurrection of Jesus Christ observed in spring
examples: Churches hold sunrise services on Easter Sunday morning
Children hunted for Easter eggs hidden in the garden

definitions: person or animal that consumes food in particular way or amount
informal term for restaurant or dining establishment
examples: He's a picky eater who avoids most vegetables
The bear is an opportunistic eater consuming fish and berries
The new burger eater downtown serves gourmet sandwiches
They found a great late-night eater near campus

definitions: informal restaurant or place where meals are served and eaten
examples: The street features dozens of small eateries and cafes
They discovered a charming Italian eatery in the neighborhood

definitions: act of consuming food by putting it in mouth and swallowing
social or cultural practice surrounding food consumption
examples: Eating fresh vegetables provides essential vitamins and minerals
The doctor advised against eating before the surgery
Their eating habits changed after moving to Japan
Family eating together strengthens social bonds

definitions: movement of tide away from shore as water level falls
gradual lessening or decline in strength, number, or quality
examples: Shells appeared on the beach during the tide's ebb
Fishermen timed their departure with the ebb tide
The ebb of enthusiasm became apparent after initial excitement
His strength began to ebb after hours of continuous effort

definitions: dense black hardwood from tropical trees valued for fine furniture
deep lustrous black color resembling the wood
examples: The piano featured elegant ebony and ivory keys
Craftsmen carved intricate designs in imported ebony wood
Her ebony hair gleamed under the stage lights
The artist used ebony ink for dramatic contrast

definitions: person who behaves unconventionally or strangely compared to social norms
rotating mechanical part with axis offset from geometric center
examples: The eccentric millionaire collected vintage typewriters obsessively
Local eccentrics gathered at the coffee shop for philosophical debates
The engineer adjusted the eccentric cam to change valve timing
An eccentric wheel creates the oscillating motion in the mechanism

definitions: quality of being unconventional and slightly strange in behavior or appearance
deviation of orbit from perfect circle measured mathematically
distance between rotation axis and geometric center in mechanical systems
examples: His eccentricity included wearing Victorian clothing to work daily
The artist's eccentricity made her gallery openings memorable events
Mars has an orbital eccentricity of approximately zero point zero nine
The comet's high eccentricity brings it close to the sun
Engineers calculated the eccentricity needed for proper cam operation
Shaft eccentricity caused unwanted vibration in the motor

definitions: member of clergy or person in religious orders within Christian church
examples: The ecclesiastic delivered sermons every Sunday at cathedral
High-ranking ecclesiastics gathered for the church council meeting

definitions: level of authority or rank within organization or society
stepped military formation with units arranged diagonally
examples: She reached the upper echelons of corporate management quickly
Decisions flow through multiple echelons of government bureaucracy
Troops advanced in echelon formation across the battlefield
The aircraft flew in echelon right formation

definitions: sound caused by reflection of sound waves from surface back to listener
close repetition or imitation of someone's words, opinions, or actions
examples: Her voice created an echo in the empty cathedral
Mountain climbers heard their echo bounce off canyon walls
His speech was an echo of his mentor's philosophy
Fashion trends often echo styles from previous decades

definitions: biological system using sound waves to navigate and locate objects used by bats and dolphins
examples: Bats use echolocation to hunt insects in complete darkness
Dolphins employ echolocation to find fish in murky water

definitions: oblong pastry made with choux dough filled with cream and topped with icing
examples: The bakery's chocolate eclairs sold out every morning
She ordered coffee and a vanilla eclair for dessert

definitions: practice of selecting and using ideas, styles, or tastes from broad diverse range of sources
examples: The designer's eclecticism combined Victorian and modern elements beautifully
Musical eclecticism defined the festival's programming this year

definitions: astronomical event where one celestial body moves into shadow of another
decline in importance, power, or prominence when surpassed by another
examples: The total solar eclipse lasted four minutes and attracted thousands
Lunar eclipses occur when Earth blocks sunlight from moon
The rise of streaming eclipsed traditional television viewing
Her fame began to eclipse that of established stars

definitions: scientist who studies relationships between organisms and their environment
examples: The ecologist tracked endangered species population changes for decades
Marine ecologists study coral reef ecosystem dynamics

definitions: branch of biology studying relationships between organisms and environment
set of relationships between different elements in a system
examples: Students majoring in ecology study ecosystem dynamics and conservation
Forest ecology examines interactions between trees, animals, and climate
The ecology of the startup ecosystem requires diverse funding sources
Urban ecology involves complex interactions between nature and cities

definitions: expert who studies production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services
examples: The economist predicted recession based on employment data
Leading economists debated monetary policy at the conference

definitions: system of trade, industry, and money in a country or region
careful management of resources to avoid waste
examples: The national economy grew three percent last quarter
Emerging economies face unique development challenges
She practiced economy by buying generic brands and using coupons
The car's fuel economy improved with regular maintenance

definitions: biological community of interacting organisms and their physical environment
complex network of interconnected elements forming a functional whole
examples: The rainforest ecosystem supports millions of species
Coral reef ecosystems face threats from ocean acidification
The tech ecosystem includes startups, investors, and universities
A healthy business ecosystem requires diverse participants

definitions: responsible travel to natural areas that conserves environment and improves local welfare
examples: Costa Rica pioneered ecotourism with protected rainforest reserves
Ecotourism provides income while preserving wildlife habitats

definitions: overwhelming feeling of great happiness or joyful excitement
illegal synthetic drug causing euphoria and heightened sensations
examples: She felt ecstasy when receiving the scholarship award
The crowd erupted in ecstasy after the winning goal
Police seized ecstasy tablets at the music festival
The dangers of ecstasy include dehydration and overheating

definitions: movement promoting unity and cooperation among different Christian churches and denominations
examples: Ecumenism encourages dialogue between Catholic and Protestant churches
The council promoted ecumenism through joint worship services

definitions: medical condition causing patches of skin to become inflamed, itchy, and rough
examples: The dermatologist prescribed cream to treat her eczema
Children with eczema should avoid harsh soaps and detergents

definitions: circular movement of water or air running contrary to main current
examples: Small eddies formed behind rocks in the fast-flowing river
Wind eddies swirled autumn leaves in the courtyard

definitions: outer limit or boundary of an object, area, or surface
slight advantage or superiority over competitors
sharp side of blade or cutting tool
examples: She stood at the edge of the cliff overlooking the ocean
The forest edge provides habitat for diverse wildlife
Their innovative technology gave them an edge over competitors
Years of experience provided her an edge in negotiations
The knife's edge needed sharpening before cutting vegetables
Be careful of the paper's edge to avoid cuts

definitions: decorative border or trimming added to garment or surface
slow careful movement in particular direction
examples: Lace edging adorned the vintage handkerchief
The garden path featured brick edging along both sides
The cat was edging closer to the unsuspecting bird
Stock prices kept edging upward throughout the trading day

definitions: quality of being safe and suitable to eat without harmful effects
examples: Scientists tested the edibility of newly discovered mushroom species
The edibility of seafood depends on proper storage temperature

definitions: food item that is safe and suitable for eating
examples: The garden produced various edibles including tomatoes and herbs
Wild edibles require careful identification before consumption

definitions: official order or proclamation issued by authority having force of law
examples: The king's edict banned public gatherings during the plague
Government edicts regulated trade in the colonial period

definitions: large imposing building especially of architectural significance
complex abstract structure or organization
examples: The Gothic edifice dominated the city's historic skyline
Ancient Roman edifices still stand after two thousand years
The entire edifice of scientific theory rests on empirical evidence
They built an edifice of lies to cover their fraud

definitions: process of correcting and preparing written material for publication
process of selecting and arranging video or audio content
examples: Careful editing improved the manuscript's clarity and flow
The editing process took several weeks of revision
Film editing created seamless transitions between scenes
Audio editing removed background noise from the podcast

definitions: particular version of published text differing from other versions
single broadcast of regularly scheduled program
examples: The first edition of the novel contained several typos
Collectors sought the limited edition with author's signature
Tonight's edition of the news features an exclusive interview
The morning edition covers local traffic and weather

definitions: person who prepares content for publication by correcting and arranging material
computer program used for creating and modifying files
examples: The editor suggested major revisions to the second chapter
Magazine editors select articles for each monthly issue
She used a text editor to write programming code
The video editor software offers professional-grade features

definitions: article expressing opinions of editor or publisher on topical issue
examples: The newspaper's editorial criticized the proposed legislation harshly
She wrote editorials supporting environmental protection measures

definitions: position or period of being editor of publication
examples: During her editorship, the journal's readership doubled significantly
He assumed editorship of the literary magazine last year

definitions: process of receiving or giving systematic instruction especially at school or university
body of knowledge acquired through learning and instruction
examples: Quality education transforms individual lives and entire communities
Online education expanded access to learning worldwide
Her education in classical music began at age five
His education included degrees from three prestigious universities
